concept.title: Stream-based XDCR
concept.shortdesc: XDCR on the source cluster collects data changes from memory and streams the data changes directly to memory on the destination cluster.

conbody.p: With stream-based XDCR replication, the data changes on the source cluster are detected in memory and streamed directly to the destination cluster's memory. On the source cluster, the data changes (in memory) are queued and then persist to disk. Correspondingly, on the destination cluster, the data changes (stream to memory) are queued and then persisted to disk.

ul.li: Lower latency, that is, the time gap between data replication
Internal changes are made automatically through the upgrade.
Only the source cluster has to be upgraded. The destination cluster accepts the data changes into memory without issue.
